title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 16-e - Final order of observation and dismissal of accusatory instrument
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 16-e - Final order of observation and dismissal of accusatory instrument

State Regulations
C.P.L Article 730
FORM 16-e
12/88
FINAL ORDER OF OBSERVATION AND
DISMISSAL OF ACCUSATORY INSTRUMENT
________ COURT OF________
COUNTY OF ________
________x
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, FINAL ORDER
OF
OBSERVATION AND
- against - DISMISSAL OF
ACCUSATORY
________, INSTRUMENT
Docket No. ________
Defendant. Indictment No. ________
________x

The above-named defendant, having been charged
with ________, in violation of ________, and having been examined pursuant to
court order by ________ psychiatric examiners, qualified in accordance with
law, and examination reports thereon having been made to this Court, and the

District Attorney and counsel for the defendant having been given copies of
such examination reports, and the Court having examined such examination
reports, copies of which are hereto attached, (Strike out one of the following two
paragraphs)
AND no motion for a hearing having been
made, AND a hearing having been held on the ________
day of ________and the following persons having appeared ____________
____________
____________
AND it appearing to my satisfaction that the
said defendant as a result of mental disease or defect lacks capacity to
understand the proceedings against (him) (her) or to assist in (his) (her) own
defense, AND it further appearing that: [NOTE: Check
one of the following four paragraphs; strike out the rest.]
the local criminal court accusatory instrument
filed against the defendant is other than a felony complaint. the indictment filed against the defendant
does not charge a felony. the defendant has been convicted of an offense
other than a felony. although a felony complaint has been filed
against the defendant, the District Attorney has consented to the entry of a
final order of observation. NOW, on motion of ____________, it is
ORDERED that the above named defendant be
committed to the custody of the Commissioner of (OMH) (OMRDD) for care and
treatment in an appropriate facility of the (OMH) (OMRDD) to be designated by
said Commissioner for a period not to exceed ninety days from the date of this
order, and it is further
ORDERED, that the defendant, if (he) (she) be
in detention, be continued in detention at ________, pending designation of an
appropriate facility by the Commissioner of (OMH) (OMRDD), and, upon notice by
the appropriate Commissioner of the designated facility, be delivered thereto
by the (Sheriff) (Commissioner of Correction of the City of New York)
and it is further
ORDERED, that the accusatory instrument filed
in this court against such defendant is hereby dismissed. Dated: ________
_________
Judge or Justice

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form
16-e

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
